ratings.comment: (PA 200) Takes attendance unnecessarily seriously & isn't accessible for those who can't make lectures, ONE absence the whole semester for BOTH lecture and discussion section. Big lecture, but tries to get participation. Grading is clear but the midterm, project and final is 75%. Project will require work, more than other 200 level classes honestly
Never went to or watched lecture, never read the textbook thoroughly, never took notes. Just went to discussion and did the reflection assignments and got a 100%.

Doherty was really boring to listen to in class and her slides are pretty disorganized. There was only one midterm and one final, so we weren't really graded on much. Attend discussion review sessions and take decent notes and the exams will be pretty easy.
Wants her students to do well. Just show up to lectures (or at least watch them) and it is hard to do poorly.

A slow talker, but if you literally just show up to class and pay attention to the lectures you should get a good grade. The class is definitely focused more on reflecting on how your race and ethnicity has shaped your life/others lives rather than focusing on extremely specific/difficult content. An easy ethnic studies credit.

This professor is a bit slow in her speaking patterns. Felt like I needed to put her in 2x speed in real life. She sort of knows the content, but she just takes all the information from the first paragraph of each textbook chapter with no context. She loves to show videos and again takes very long pauses.

her lectures are extremely boring and dry, you can take everything from the slides
every week we had to write 2 page reflections in addition to about 4 readings each week (ranging from 3-40 pages each)

Sociology 134: One of her first big lectures, this came off as she was a bit timid when speaking. Other than that she is a nice professor with pretty easy homework. Would highly recommend attending lecture as the exams were very lecture heavy but not hard at all. Very clear she just wants you to learn and absorb what she is teaching

Class was pretty easy. You have weekly readings/ quizzes. The quizzes aren't every week though, and you can retake it as many times as you want/ use notes/textbook. You have weekly reflections. The exams are pretty straight forward multiple choice. attendance not required for lecture but it is for discussion. This class was so BORING though!!
